definition[0]: two statements that are inconsistent cannot both be true
example[0]: The accounts of the witnesses are inconsistent.
example[1]: His results are inconsistent with our data.
definition[1]: not right according to a particular set of principles or standards
example[2]: His conduct was inconsistent with what is expected of a congressman.
definition[2]: inconsistent behaviour, work etc changes too often from good to bad
example[3]: The teamâ€™s performance has been highly inconsistent this season.
